tourBios.intlVics: (3): 2004 Crowne Plaza Shanghai Classic [Asia], Sanya Open [Asia]. 2005 Brunei Open [Asia].
tourBios.carHigh: Member of the European Tour from 2005-10. Has also played the Asian Tour and Australasian Tours. Won three times on the Asian Tour. Missed the cut at the 2007 and 2009 British Opens and the 2010 U.S. Open. 2010: One made cut in two events, a T61 at the Micheal Hill New Zealand Open. 2009: Made eight career starts and four cuts on the Nationwide Tour, with his best finish a T4 at the Moonah Classic in Australia.
tourBios.personal: Lists Steve Bann, Darren Cole and Christian Neumaier as instructors...Says winning back-to-back events on the Asian Tour in 2004 was his biggest thrill in golf. The birth of his children is his biggest thrill outside of golf...Says Carnoustie is his favorite course and would like to play Augusta National. Favorite team is the West Coast Eagles, an Australian Rules Football team based in Perth...Favorite TV show is "Seinfeld," and "Coupe de Ville" is his favorite movie. Chris Rock is his favorite entertainer, and Usain Bolt is his favorite athlete to watch. Rome, Italy, Moscow, Russia, and Shanghai, China, are his favorite cities to visit, and Rome is his top vacation spot...Would round out his dream foursome with Ben Hogan, Jack Nicklaus and Bobby Jones...Says not many people know he has an associate diploma in business...Bucket list includes visiting Mt. Everest, the Pyramids of Egypt and Niagara Falls.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was T4th in 2009 at the Moonah Classic.
